Description: The Return from Egypt; the Infant Jesus walking between the Virgin and St Joseph; Joseph leading his donkey by the harness; arched composition; after Peter Paul Rubens Engraving
Curator's comments: After the painting by Rubens now in the Wadsworth Atheneum, Connecticut (Rooses 182); sold to Charles Butler in 1886 (Rooses 182); formerly in the collection of the Duke of Marlborough. This is one of two paintings by Rubens that Marlborough bought in 1708 from the royal collections of the Castle of Tervuren. A drawing (without the large tree) is in Musée du Louvre, Paris, inv.no.20.304. Reproduces Vorsterman's composition (see Schneevoogt 26.124).
Bibliographic references: Schneevoogt 1873 / Catalogue des estampes gravées d'après P.P.Rubens (26.121)
Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (11) (copy g; under Lucas Vorsterman I)
Subjects: return of the holy family from egypt
